column4: *question* im new to linux and trying to install gtk-gnutella, i used synapics to do it but it installed an outdated version, can anyone walk me through how to install the latest version? i just downloaded it off the sourceforge site
you'll most likey need to install build-essential
then you need to decompress the archive you got, tar xjf gtk-gnutella<whatever>.tar.bz2
ok, it probably told you you don't have GTK installed, right?
then it doesn't know you have gcc, just ctrl-c and start again
I don't know what you mean, most configure scripts are automatic
or bison, it may be the same thing
no, the version you compile should install to /usr/local instead of /usr
do you have the GTK development packages and all that installed?
configure didn't tell you it was missing?
for anything you need to build from source, you'll need -dev packages install for any libraries it uses
you can search for t by using apt-cache search <libraryname> and find anything with -dev after it
configure should tell you if libraries it needs are missing
well, I gotta get back to work, hope someone else can pick up from here
